Description: Body sherd of South Ionian Fikellura pottery oinochoe; pale slip; glaze fired red-brown; exterior, from top: frieze of crescents; pair of bands; frieze of lotus flowers and buds; interior reserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Group U. According to pottery analysis by P. Dupont (personal communication, 30-31 May 1978) at the Centre de recherches archéologiques, laboratoire de céramologie, the clay from this sherd originated in Miletus. Modern inscription written in ink 'NAU 44' on break (accession number used in clay analysis).
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 129, Nau 94, pl. 21e)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 248, no. 3)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (p. 3)
Dupont & Thomas 2006 / Naukratis: Les Importations Grecques Orientales Archaïques (p. 78-79, 82, 84, fig. 3) (NAU 44)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.150)
